page.title: 19Farming
page.content: 17 farms are located in the block. The land has a sandy subsoil as it is mainly reclaimed. For this reason, wet land was expected , but it is so well drained that one farm has installed an irrigator to provide more water. Much of the land is managed grassland for pasture and silage used on dairy farms such as Birchen Fields, Bumpers Lane and Fir Tree Farms. Thornleigh Park had a dairy herd before the 1967 outbreak of foot and mouth disease. It now has new owners with 190 beef cattle. Barley, wheat, potatoes, oil seed rape, peas and kale are also grown; the widest range being at Bank Farm. Finding out about farming is great fun. All of the farming families were very friendly and helpful.
